p: The Comoros islands form an archipelago of volcanic islands located off the southeastern coast of Africa, east of Mozambique and northwest of Madagascar. The archipelago is divided between the sovereign state of the Union of Comoros composed of three islands named Grande Comore, Moheli, and Anjouan, and the French overseas department of Mayotte. The tropical climate of the Comoros islands is characterized by daytime temperatures around 26Â°C at sea level, with limited variation during the year, and by annual heavy rainfall (2,679 mm) with two seasons: a humid season from November to April, and a dry season from May to October.
